meanings.definition: A thin, crisp disc-shaped Indian food made from lentil flour.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat papadams with my curry for a crunchy texture.
meanings.sent2: The papadam served at the restaurant was perfectly crispy and flavorful.
meanings.sent3: When the papadam cracked loudly, it startled everyone at the table.
meanings.sent4: The papadam was like a delicate, flavorful frisbee on my plate.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly fried papadam filled the room with a tempting scent.

meanings.definition: To cook or heat up a papadam before serving.
meanings.sent1: Please papadam the appetizers before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The chef will papadam the lentil crisps to make them extra crispy.
meanings.sent3: I papadamed the papadams quickly so they wouldn't be soggy.
meanings.sent4: She papadams the discs with precision, ensuring they are perfectly heated.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of papadaming papadams wafted through the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
